meanings.sent1: Before dyeing the fabric, she always does presoaking to ensure the color sets well.
meanings.sent2: I presoak the beans overnight before cooking them for a better texture.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he was presoaking the vegetables to give them a head start in the pot.
meanings.sent4: The rain presoaked the ground, making it easier for the plants to absorb water.
meanings.sent5: Presoaking the shirt in detergent helped remove the stubborn stain completely.

meanings.definition: The act of soaking something before use.
meanings.sent1: The presoaking of the wood in oil made it more resistant to water damage.
meanings.sent2: Presoaking the seeds in water overnight helps speed up the germination process.
meanings.sent3: The presoaking of the sponge in soapy water made it easier to clean the dishes.
meanings.sent4: The presoaking of the canvas in primer ensured a smooth painting surface.
meanings.sent5: Presoaking the cloth in fabric softener gave it a pleasant scent after drying.
